elements.title: the terracotta statue of George Washington (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the terracotta statue of George Washington (pictured) by the Danish-American sculptor Nels N. Alling was entirely funded by the local Scandinavian community?

elements.title: Walkelin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Walkelin, Bishop of Winchester, began the construction of the modern Winchester Cathedral in 1079?

elements.title: Yun Hai (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that New York store Yun Hai raised nine times its fundraising target to support Taiwanese farmers after China banned the import of their pineapples?

elements.title: Nadia Smyrnytska (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ukrainians Nadia Smyrnytska, Maria Kalyuzhnaya and Maria Kovalevska joined other prisoners in committing suicide to protest against the abuse of imprisoned women in Kara katorga?

elements.title: Heinrich Nidecker (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Heinrich Nidecker accused Samuel Taylor Coleridge of having committed plagiarism in his philosophical tract Theory of Life?

elements.title: Cliff Davis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Cliff Davis spent $53 during his 1960 campaign for a seat in the Wyoming House of Representatives?

elements.title: Sky Above Clouds IV (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sky Above Clouds IV was inspired by a large, blank white wall?

elements.title: an Inuit interpreter (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a species of butterfly was named in honor of an Inuit interpreter?
